Ekonomi RI Mandek di 5%, Wamenkeu: Negara Lain Jauh Lebih Rendah
06 Nov 2019, 05:35 by Danang Sugianto


Wakil Menteri Keuangan Suahasil Nazara/Foto: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - Perekonomian Indonesia masih belum bisa keluar dari level 5%. Pada kuartal III-2019 pertumbuhan Indonesia 5,02%, lebih rendah dari pertumbuhan di periode yang sama tahun lalu 5,17%.Wakil Menteri Keuangan Suahasil Nazara menilai pertumbuhan ekonomi RI yang sedikit tertekan merupakan hal yang wajar di tengah gejolak perekonomian global. Hal itu bahkan mempengaruhi pertumbuhan ekonomi secara global."Kita lihat pertumbuhan ekonomi dunia diprediksi hanya 3,0%. Perkiraan itu turun terus. Awalnya prediksi 3,7%, turun ke 3,5%, turun ke 3,2% dan terakhir 3,0%," ujarnya di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Gejolak ekonomi global yang terjadi telah telah mengganggu jalur perdagangan banyak negara termasuk Indonesia. Salah satu penyebab terbesar adalah memanasnya hubungan dagang dua negara ekonomi besar yakni Amerika Serikat (AS) dan China."Maka pasti permintaan akan ekspor dari Indonesia juga menurun ini yang kita lihat beberapa bulan terakhir tertekan. Data yang dikeluarkan BPS ekspor praktis flat 0%. Di sisi lain perekonomian Indonesia yang memiliki impor konten lumayan juga akan kena imbasnya," ujarnya.Dengan kondisi itu, menurut Suahasil tidak heran juga berdampak negatif juga ke perekonomian domestik Indonesia, sehingga wajar jika pertumbuhan ekonomi di kuartal III-2019 sedikit tertekan."Perekonomian kita meski tumbuh 5,02%, itu lebih rendah dibanding beberapa kuartal sebelumnya. Ini dampak dari kondisi global dan kita secara berkelanjutan berusaha memberikan support agar perekonomian bisa dijaga momentum pertumbuhannya," terangnya.Meski begitu, Suahasil menilai pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia masih patut disyukuri. Sebab banyak negara lain yang penurunan pertumbuhannya jauh lebih rendah bahkan terkoreksi. "5,02% bukan angka rendah, ini harusnya bisa memberikan optimisme. Banyak negara lain yang jauh lebih rendah dan levelnya bahkan seperti Tiongkok yang sekarang level 6% turunya dari 2-3 tahun lalu cukup tajam. Tiongkok biasanya tumbuh double digit 10-11% turunnya ke 6%. Indonesia masih steady di level 5% dan akan kita jaga momentumnya," tegasnya. RI Economy Stagnates at 5%, Deputy Minister of Finance: Other Countries Much Lower
Nov 6, 2019, 05:35 by Danang Sugianto


Deputy Minister of Finance Suahasil Nazara / Photo: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - Indonesia's economy is still unable to come out of the 5% level. In the third quarter of 2019 Indonesia's growth was 5.02%, lower than the 5.17% growth in the same period last year. Deputy Minister of Finance Suahasil Nazara said that Indonesia's slightly depressed economic growth was normal in the midst of global economic turmoil. It even affects global economic growth. "We see that world economic growth is predicted to be only 3.0%. The estimate is continuing to fall. Initially the prediction was 3.7%, down to 3.5%, down to 3.2% and finally 3 , 0%, "he said at the Fairmont Hotel, Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019). The global economic turmoil that has occurred has disrupted the trade routes of many countries including Indonesia. One of the biggest causes is the warming of trade relations between the two major economies, namely the United States (US) and China. "So surely the demand for exports from Indonesia is also declining, which we have seen in recent months is depressed. Data released by BPS exports are practically flat at 0%. On the other hand the Indonesian economy which has a fair amount of imported content will also be affected, "he said. With that condition, according to Suahasil, it is not surprising that it also has a negative impact on the Indonesian domestic economy, so it is natural that economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 is slightly depressed." even though we grew 5.02%, it was lower than in the previous quarters. This is the impact of global conditions and we are continuously trying to provide support so that the economy can be maintained with growth momentum, "he explained. Even so, Suahasil assesses Indonesia's economic growth is still to be grateful for. Because many other countries whose growth has declined are even lower and even corrected. "5.02% is not a low number, this should be able to provide optimism. Many other countries are much lower and the level is even like China where the current 6% level dropped from 2-3 years ago is quite sharp. China usually grows double digit 10-11 "The decline is down to 6%. Indonesia is still steady at the level of 5% and we will keep the momentum," he said.
